alert.note: Alert for Valley (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 19 at 7:56PM MDT until April 26 at 6:41PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Milk River at Glasgow affecting Valley County. For the Milk River...including Tampico and Glasgow...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Milk River at Glasgow. * WHEN...Until Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 30 feet, storm drainage valves along the Glasgow levee will back-flood into the southside of Glasgow if not closed. Some flooding is occurring on Rahlf Lake off of Highway 24. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM MDT Wednesday the stage was 30.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM MDT Wednesday was 30.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Tuesday evening and continue falling to 21.6 feet Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning by 1130 AM MDT.
